name: Medicine Buddha Amulet/Prayer Bag
description:
Amulet bags are used to carry sacred objects and prayers. 
What I like to do is use small slips of paper, write my wish or prayer on it, put it in the bag and once my wish or prayer has been granted, burn it and offer the ashes to the four winds.

This bag has a small charm of Buddha on it, in Buddhism Medicine Buddha is known as a healer. Done in shades of blue and white I wanted a healing energy to come through in this bag. I used labradorite, lapis, and moonstone in the neck strap and hematite and labradorite in the fringe. This is a very soothing bag that will provide a lot of healing to the wearer. It measures 14 inches exact from the clasp to the end of the fringe. Any questions? Just ask!!!

name: Tiger's Eye and Blood Stone Mala
description: This is a blood stone and tiger's eye mala done in the traditional 108 count style. The guru bead is a DZI bead which are found in Tibet, they are an agate type bead that have a pattern on them this particular one is known as a dragon eye bead, the pattern looks like eyes. This mala measures 21 inches from center marker bead to the end of the fringe. I used tiger's eye and bronze colored disc beads for markers. The fringe has tiger's eye, rain forest jasper, potato pearls and wood disc beads. I also used a swirled green glass disc beads on the ends of the fringe. This one of my more unique malas because of the DZI guru bead. If you have any questions please ask and I will get back to you! Thank you for looking and much Metta!

name: Native Fringe Necklace
description: This fringe collar necklace is made in shades of gold, turquoise, and coffee brown. I used tiger's eye, black obsidian, and black agate beads with beautiful pale blue crystal drops as an accent. The fringe goes all the way around the collar with longer dangles in the front, the clasp on the back is adjustable, you can make it longer or shorter. This is a one of a kind collar necklace and would be a great addition to any jewelry wardrobe!!!!
